intro: Lesquerella pallida, commonly known as the pale lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, alternate leaves, and small, yellowish-white flowers. Lesquerella pallida produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
